thread.title: Fighting relegation, Leeds and coach Uwe Rosler go separate ways after latest defeat
thread.title_full: Fighting relegation, Leeds and coach Uwe Rosler go separate ways after latest defeat

title: Fighting relegation, Leeds and coach Uwe Rosler go separate ways after latest defeat
text:
Fighting relegation, Leeds and coach Uwe Rosler go separate ways after latest defeat THE ASSOCIATED PRESS   6:24   6:24   
Subjects: 
United Kingdom (463) 
LEEDS, England — Leeds says that coach Uwe Rosler has left the Championship club, following a third consecutive defeat for the relegation strugglers. 
Leeds tweeted that "Uwe Rosler has parted company with the club" and that a full statement would be released later Monday. 
Saturday's 2-1 home defeat to Brighton has left Leeds in 18th place in the 24-team second tier of English football, just three points above the relegation zone. 
Rosler was appointed in May on a two-year contract. The 46-year-old German coach had previously managed Wigan and Brentford. 
A force in domestic and European football from the late 1960s to the mid-1970s, Leeds has struggled over the past decade and the team has yet to win at Elland Road this season.
